result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul D. Dopp was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)2.
  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Repeater, Second and Subsequent Offense], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay al costs, surcharges, and drug buy money at least 90 days prior to release. If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Per Wisconsin Statute, funds from prison accounts may be used for obligations in accordance with prison policy not to exceed 25% of gross.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.

AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment /Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.

Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Engage and comply in any other counseling/treatment reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
Must sign release form for all treatment providers.  Sign all releases of information for all doctors and other treatment providers and pharmacy.
Submit DNA sample, if not already done so.

records.addlTxt:
1:52 p.m. Defendant Paul D. Dopp in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Paul D. Dopp in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have received the PSI report.  State requests prison sentence w/conditions.
Atty Barkely request probation and states there is 226 days credit he has calculated.
Defendant makes statements to the Court.
BY THE COURT:***PRISON****

Count 2:   44 months   Incarceration and  36 month   Extended Supervision, 226 days credit
Conditions: Eligible for both challenge and substance abuse programs.
 No contact with Ben Kubisiak.
  AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
  Defendant ordered to have a Mental Health Assessment/Psychological Evaluation and to comply with any recommended treatment.
  Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
  Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
  Engage and comply in any other counseling/treatment reasonably related to the offense as recommended by the Agent.
  Must sign release form for all treatment providers.  Sign all releases of information for all doctors and other treatment providers and pharmacy.
Pay all costs 90 days prior to release.
Pay Buy money reimbursement of $2050.00.
Pay at up to 25%
  Obtain and maintain full-time employment or schooling or a combination of both equaling full-time.
DNA sample.

Count 3: 30 Incarceration and 24 mo Extended Superision, concurrent
Comply with same conditions.

Appeal rights provided.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on August 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Paul D. Dopp in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Defendant Paul D. Dopp in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
10:27 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  Counts 2 & 3 - NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty Counts 2 & 3.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Counts 1, 4 & 5 are dismissed and read-in. 
Court orders a PSI. 

Atty Barkley makes statements to the Court. 
Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court.  Asks the court to revoke the bond. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond is revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on June 2, 2016 at 10:00 am.
/s/ RJS
Status conference on May 31, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Status conference on May 9, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 25, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul D. Dopp in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
3:05 p.m.  Court calls the case. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions Attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 10:00 am.

ADA  Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins  states facts for anticipated charges of Possess Methamphetine and Manufacture/Deliver Phencyclidine/Amphetamine and Possession with intent to deliver Heroin.
